member.name: F:Native.SM.CXSIZEFRAME
member.summary: The thickness of the sizing border around the perimeter of a window that can be resized, in pixels. is the width of the horizontal border, and is the height of the vertical border. This value is the same as SM_CXFRAME.

member.name: F:Native.SM.CXSMICON
member.summary: The recommended width of a small icon, in pixels. Small icons typically appear in window captions and in small icon view.

member.name: F:Native.SM.CXSMSIZE

member.name: F:Native.SM.DBCSENABLED
member.summary: Nonzero if User32.dll supports DBCS; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Native.SM.DEBUG
member.summary: Nonzero if the debug version of User.exe is installed; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Native.SM.DIGITIZER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2 and the Tablet PC Input service is started; otherwise, 0. The return value is a bitmask that specifies the type of digitizer input supported by the device.

member.name: F:Native.SM.IMMENABLED
member.summary: Nonzero if Input Method Manager/Input Method Editor features are enabled; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Native.SM.MAXIMUMTOUCHES
member.summary: Nonzero if there are digitizers in the system; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Native.SM.MEDIACENTER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is the Windows XP, Media Center Edition, 0 if not.

member.name: F:Native.SM.MENUDROPALIGNMENT
member.summary: Nonzero if drop-down menus are right-aligned with the corresponding menu-bar item; 0 if the menus are left-aligned.

member.name: F:Native.SM.MIDEASTENABLED
member.summary: Nonzero if the system is enabled for Hebrew and Arabic languages, 0 if not.

member.name: F:Native.SM.MOUSEPRESENT
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse is installed; otherwise, 0. This value is rarely zero, because of support for virtual mice and because some systems detect the presence of the port instead of the presence of a mouse.

member.name: F:Native.SM.MOUSEHORIZONTALWHEELPRESENT
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse with a horizontal scroll wheel is installed; otherwise 0.

member.name: F:Native.SM.MOUSEWHEELPRESENT
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse with a vertical scroll wheel is installed; otherwise 0.

member.name: F:Native.SM.NETWORK
member.summary: The least significant bit is set if a network is present; otherwise, it is cleared. The other bits are reserved for future use.

member.name: F:Native.SM.PENWINDOWS
member.summary: Nonzero if the Microsoft Windows for Pen computing extensions are installed; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:Native.SM.REMOTECONTROL
member.summary: This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment to determine if the current Terminal Server session is being remotely controlled. Its value is nonzero if the current session is remotely controlled; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Native.SM.REMOTESESSION
member.summary: This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment. If the calling process is associated with a Terminal Services client session, the return value is nonzero. If the calling process is associated with the Terminal Services console session, the return value is 0.

member.name: F:Native.SM.SAMEDISPLAYFORMAT
member.summary: Nonzero if all the display monitors have the same color format, otherwise, 0. Two displays can have the same bit depth, but different color formats. For example, the red, green, and blue pixels can be encoded with different numbers of bits, or those bits can be located in different places in a pixel color value.

member.name: F:Native.SM.SECURE
member.summary: This system metric should be ignored; it always returns 0.

member.name: F:Native.SM.SERVERR2
member.summary: The build number if the system is Windows Server 2003 R2; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Native.SM.SHOWSOUNDS
member.summary: Nonzero if the user requires an application to present information visually in situations where it would otherwise present the information only in audible form; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Native.SM.SHUTTINGDOWN
member.summary: Nonzero if the current session is shutting down; otherwise, 0.
member.remarks: Windows 2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Native.SM.SLOWMACHINE
member.summary: Nonzero if the computer has a low-end (slow) processor; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Native.SM.SWAPBUTTON
member.summary: Nonzero if the meanings of the left and right mouse buttons are swapped; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Native.SM.STARTER
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is Windows 7 Starter Edition, Windows Vista Starter, or Windows XP Starter Edition; otherwise, 0.

member.name: F:Native.SM.TABLETPC
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is the Windows XP Tablet PC edition or if the current operating system is Windows Vista or Windows 7 and the Tablet PC Input service is started; otherwise, 0. The setting indicates the type of digitizer input supported by a device running Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2.

member.name: F:Native.SM.XVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: The coordinates for the left side of the virtual screen. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors. The metric is the width of the virtual screen.

member.name: F:Native.SM.YVIRTUALSCREEN
member.summary: The coordinates for the top of the virtual screen. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors. The metric is the height of the virtual screen.

member.name: F:Native.DeviceCaps.NUMBRUSHES
member.summary: Number of brushes the device has.

member.name: F:Native.DeviceCaps.NUMPENS
member.summary: Number of pens the device has.

member.summary: Number of markers the device has.

member.name: F:Native.DeviceCaps.NUMFONTS
member.summary: Number of fonts the device has.

member.name: F:Native.DeviceCaps.NUMCOLORS
member.summary: Number of colors the device supports.

member.name: F:Native.DeviceCaps.SIZEPALETTE
member.summary: Number of entries in physical palette.

member.name: F:Native.DeviceCaps.NUMRESERVED
member.summary: Number of reserved entries in palette.

member.name: F:Native.DeviceCaps.VREFRESH
member.summary: Current vertical refresh rate of the display device (for displays only) in Hz.

member.name: F:Native.DeviceCaps.DESKTOPVERTRES
member.summary: Horizontal width of entire desktop in pixels.

member.name: F:Native.DeviceCaps.DESKTOPHORZRES
member.summary: Vertical height of entire desktop in pixels.

member.name: F:Native.SWP.NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:Native.SWP.NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores x and y parameters).

member.name: F:Native.SWP.NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Native.SWP.NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:Native.SWP.NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Native.SWP.DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:Native.SWP.FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the function. Sends a message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:Native.SWP.NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:Native.SWP.NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:Native.SWP.NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the message.

member.name: F:Native.SWP.ASYNCWINDOWPOS
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: F:Native.DWMWA.ALLOW_NCPAINT
member.summary: [set] Allow contents rendered in the non-client area to be visible on the DWM-drawn frame.

member.name: F:Native.DWMWA.CAPTION_BUTTON_BOUNDS
member.summary: [get] Bounds of the caption button area in window-relative space.

member.name: F:Native.DWMWA.FORCE_ICONIC_REPRESENTATION
member.summary: [set] Force this window to display iconic thumbnails.

member.name: F:Native.DWMWA.FLIP3D_POLICY
member.summary: [set] Designates how Flip3D will treat the window.

member.name: F:Native.DWMWA.EXTENDED_FRAME_BOUNDS
member.summary: [get] Gets the extended frame bounds rectangle in screen space.

member.name: F:Native.DWMWA.HAS_ICONIC_BITMAP
member.summary: [set] Indicates an available bitmap when there is no better thumbnail representation.
member.remarks: Windows Vista and earlier: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Native.DWMWA.DISALLOW_PEEK

member.remarks: Windows Vista and earlier: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Native.DWMWA.EXCLUDED_FROM_PEEK
member.remarks: Windows Vista and earlier: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Native.DWMWA.CLOAK
member.remarks: Do not use.

member.name: F:Native.DWMWA.CLOAKED
member.summary: [get] Gets the cloaked state of the window.
member.remarks: Windows 7 and earlier: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Native.DWMWA.FREEZE_REPRESENTATION
member.summary: [set] Force this window to freeze the thumbnail without live update.
member.remarks: Windows 7 and earlier: This value is not supported.

member.summary: Disabled non-client rendering; window style is ignored.

member.name: F:Native.DWMNCRP.ENABLED
member.summary: Enabled non-client rendering; window style is ignored.

member.name: F:Native.DWMFLIP3D.EXCLUDEABOVE

member.summary: The window was cloaked by the Shell.

member.name: F:Native.DWM_CLOAKED.INHERITED

member.name: F:Native.DWM_BB.ENABLE
member.summary: A value for the fEnable member has been specified.

member.name: F:Native.DWM_BB.TRANSITIONONMAXIMIZED
member.summary: A value for the fTransitionOnMaximized member has been specified.

member.name: F:Native.FLASHW.ALL
member.summary: Flash both the window caption and taskbar button. This is equivalent to setting the CAPTION | TRAY flags.

member.name: F:Native.FLASHW.STOP
member.summary: Stop flashing. The system restores the window to its original state.

member.name: F:Native.FLASHW.TIMER
member.summary: Flash continuously, until the STOP flag is set.

member.name: F:Native.FLASHW.TIMERNOFG
member.summary: Flash continuously until the window comes to the foreground.

member.name: T:Native.MONITOR
member.summary: Flags for . Determines the function's return value if the window does not intersect any display monitor.

member.name: F:Native.MONITOR.DEFAULTTOPRIMARY
member.summary: Returns a handle to the primary display monitor.

member.name: F:Native.MONITOR.DEFAULTTONEAREST
member.summary: Returns a handle to the display monitor that is nearest to the window.

member.name: F:Native.ULW.ALPHA
member.summary: Use pblend as the blend function. If the display mode is 256 colors or less, the effect of this value is the same as the effect of ULW_OPAQUE.

member.name: F:Native.ULW.COLORKEY
member.summary: Use crKey as the transparency color.

member.name: F:Native.AW.ACTIVATE
member.summary: Activates the window. Do not use this value with .

member.name: F:Native.AW.BLEND
member.summary: Uses a fade effect. This flag can be used only if hwnd is a top-level window.

member.name: F:Native.AW.CENTER
member.summary: Makes the window appear to collapse inward if is used or expand outward if the is not used. The various direction flags have no effect.

member.name: F:Native.AW.HIDE
member.summary: Hides the window. By default, the window is shown.

member.name: F:Native.AW.HOR_POSITIVE
member.summary: Animates the window from left to right. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation. It is ignored when used with or .

member.name: F:Native.AW.HOR_NEGATIVE
member.summary: Animates the window from right to left. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation. It is ignored when used with or .

member.name: F:Native.AW.SLIDE
member.summary: Uses slide animation. By default, roll animation is used. This flag is ignored when used with .

member.name: F:Native.AW.VER_POSITIVE
member.summary: Animates the window from top to bottom. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation. It is ignored when used with or .

member.name: F:Native.AW.VER_NEGATIVE
member.summary: Animates the window from bottom to top. This flag can be used with roll or slide animation. It is ignored when used with or .

member.name: F:Native.RDW.INVALIDATE
member.summary: Invalidates the rectangle or region that you specify in lprcUpdate or hrgnUpdate. You can set only one of these parameters to a non-NULL value. If both are NULL, RDW_INVALIDATE invalidates the entire window.

member.name: F:Native.RDW.INTERNALPAINT
member.summary: Causes the OS to post a WM_PAINT message to the window regardless of whether a portion of the window is invalid.

member.name: F:Native.RDW.ERASE
member.summary: Causes the window to receive a WM_ERASEBKGND message when the window is repainted. Specify this value in combination with the RDW_INVALIDATE value; otherwise, RDW_ERASE has no effect.

member.name: F:Native.RDW.VALIDATE
member.summary: Validates the rectangle or region that you specify in lprcUpdate or hrgnUpdate. You can set only one of these parameters to a non-NULL value. If both are NULL, RDW_VALIDATE validates the entire window. This value does not affect internal WM_PAINT messages.

member.name: F:Native.RDW.NOINTERNALPAINT
member.summary: Suppresses any pending internal WM_PAINT messages. This flag does not affect WM_PAINT messages resulting from a non-NULL update area.

member.name: F:Native.RDW.NOCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes child windows, if any, from the repainting operation.

member.name: F:Native.RDW.ALLCHILDREN
member.summary: Includes child windows, if any, in the repainting operation.

member.name: F:Native.RDW.UPDATENOW
member.summary: Causes the affected windows, which you specify by setting the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN values, to receive WM_ERASEBKGND and WM_PAINT messages before the RedrawWindow returns, if necessary.

member.name: F:Native.RDW.ERASENOW
member.summary: Causes the affected windows, which you specify by setting the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN values, to receive WM_ERASEBKGND messages before RedrawWindow returns, if necessary. The affected windows receive WM_PAINT messages at the ordinary time.

member.name: F:Native.RDW.FRAME
member.summary: Causes any part of the nonclient area of the window that intersects the update region to receive a WM_NCPAINT message. The RDW_INVALIDATE flag must also be specified; otherwise, RDW_FRAME has no effect. The WM_NCPAINT message is typically not sent during the execution of RedrawWindow unless either RDW_UPDATENOW or RDW_ERASENOW is specified.

member.name: F:Native.RDW.NOFRAME
member.summary: Suppresses any pending WM_NCPAINT messages. This flag must be used with RDW_VALIDATE and is typically used with RDW_NOCHILDREN. RDW_NOFRAME should be used with care, as it could cause parts of a window to be painted improperly.

member.name: F:Native.StockObject.NULL_PEN
member.summary: Null pen. The null pen draws nothing.

member.name: F:Native.StockObject.OEM_FIXED_FONT
member.summary: Original equipment manufacturer (OEM) dependent fixed-pitch (monospace) font.

member.name: F:Native.StockObject.SYSTEM_FONT
member.summary: System font. By default, the system uses the system font to draw menus, dialog box controls, and text. It is not recommended that you use DEFAULT_GUI_FONT or SYSTEM_FONT to obtain the font used by dialogs and windows. The default system font is Tahoma.

member.name: F:Native.StockObject.DEFAULT_PALETTE
member.summary: Default palette. This palette consists of the static colors in the system palette.

member.name: F:Native.StockObject.DEFAULT_GUI_FONT
member.summary: Default font for user interface objects such as menus and dialog boxes. It is not recommended that you use DEFAULT_GUI_FONT or SYSTEM_FONT to obtain the font used by dialogs and windows. The default font is Tahoma.

member.name: F:Native.StockObject.DC_BRUSH
member.summary: Solid color brush. The default color is white. The color can be changed by using the SetDCBrushColor function. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Native.StockObject.DC_PEN
member.summary: Solid pen color. The default color is white. The color can be changed by using the SetDCPenColor function. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Native.POINTER_MESSAGE_FLAG.CONFIDENCE
member.summary: Pointer is considered unlikely to be accidental.

member.name: F:Native.POINTER_MESSAGE_FLAG.CANCELED
member.summary: Pointer is departing in an abnormal manner.

member.name: T:Native.BITMAPINFOHEADER
member.summary: The BITMAPINFOHEADER structure contains information about the dimensions and color format of a DIB.

member.name: F:Native.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biSize
member.summary: The number of bytes required by the structure.

member.name: F:Native.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biWidth
member.summary: The width of the bitmap, in pixels.
member.remarks: If biCompression is BI_JPEG or BI_PNG, the biWidth member specifies the width of the decompressed JPEG or PNG image file, respectively.

member.name: F:Native.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biHeight
member.summary: The height of the bitmap, in pixels. If biHeight is positive, the bitmap is a bottom-up DIB and its origin is the lower-left corner. If biHeight is negative, the bitmap is a top-down DIB and its origin is the upper-left corner.
member.remarks: If biHeight is negative, indicating a top-down DIB, biCompression must be either BI_RGB or BI_BITFIELDS. Top-down DIBs cannot be compressed. If biCompression is BI_JPEG or BI_PNG, the biHeight member specifies the height of the decompressed JPEG or PNG image file, respectively.

member.name: F:Native.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biPlanes
member.summary: The number of planes for the target device. This value must be set to 1.

member.name: F:Native.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biBitCount
member.summary: The number of bits-per-pixel. The biBitCount member of the BITMAPINFOHEADER structure determines the number of bits that define each pixel and the maximum number of colors in the bitmap. This member must be one of the following values: 0, 1, 4, 8, 16, 24, 32

member.name: F:Native.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biCompression
member.summary: The type of compression for a compressed bottom-up bitmap (top-down DIBs cannot be compressed).

member.name: F:Native.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biSizeImage
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the image. This may be set to zero for BI_RGB bitmaps.

member.name: F:Native.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biXPelsPerMeter
member.summary: The horizontal resolution, in pixels-per-meter, of the target device for the bitmap. An application can use this value to select a bitmap from a resource group that best matches the characteristics of the current device.

member.name: F:Native.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biYPelsPerMeter
member.summary: The vertical resolution, in pixels-per-meter, of the target device for the bitmap.

member.name: F:Native.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biClrUsed
member.summary: The number of color indexes in the color table that are actually used by the bitmap. If this value is zero, the bitmap uses the maximum number of colors corresponding to the value of the biBitCount member for the compression mode specified by biCompression.

member.name: F:Native.BITMAPINFOHEADER.biClrImportant
member.summary: The number of color indexes that are required for displaying the bitmap. If this value is zero, all colors are required.

member.param: Reader to read from.

member.param: Writer to write to.

member.name: T:Native.BLENDFUNCTION
member.summary: The structure controls blending by specifying the blending functions for source and destination bitmaps.

member.name: F:Native.BLENDFUNCTION.BlendOp
member.summary: The source blend operation. Currently, the only source and destination blend operation that has been defined is AC_SRC_OVER.

member.name: F:Native.BLENDFUNCTION.SourceConstantAlpha
member.summary: Specifies an alpha transparency value to be used on the entire source bitmap. The SourceConstantAlpha value is combined with any per-pixel alpha values in the source bitmap. If you set SourceConstantAlpha to 0, it is assumed that your image is transparent. Set the SourceConstantAlpha value to 255 (opaque) when you only want to use per-pixel alpha values.

member.name: F:Native.BLENDFUNCTION.AlphaFormat
member.summary: This member controls the way the source and destination bitmaps are interpreted.

member.name: T:Native.PAINTSTRUCT
member.summary: The PAINTSTRUCT structure contains information for an application. This information can be used to paint the client area of a window owned by that application.

member.name: F:Native.PAINTSTRUCT.hdc
member.summary: A handle to the display DC to be used for painting.

member.name: F:Native.PAINTSTRUCT.fErase
member.summary: Indicates whether the background must be erased. This value is nonzero if the application should erase the background. The application is responsible for erasing the background if a window class is created without a background brush. For more information, see the description of the hbrBackground member of the WNDCLASS structure.

member.name: F:Native.PAINTSTRUCT.rcPaint
member.summary: A structure that specifies the upper left and lower right corners of the rectangle in which the painting is requested, in device units relative to the upper-left corner of the client area.

member.name: T:Native.WINDOWPOS
member.summary: Contains information about the size and position of a window.

member.name: F:Native.WINDOWPOS.hwndInsertAfter
member.summary: The position of the window in Z order (front-to-back position). This member can be a handle to the window behind which this window is placed, or can be one of the special values listed with the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:Native.WINDOWPOS.x
member.summary: The position of the left edge of the window.

member.name: F:Native.WINDOWPOS.y
member.summary: The position of the top edge of the window.

member.name: F:Native.WINDOWPOS.flags
member.summary: The window position. This member can be one or more of the following values:

member.name: T:Native.DWM_BLURBEHIND
member.summary: Specifies Desktop Window Manager (DWM) blur-behind properties. Used by the function.

member.name: F:Native.DWM_BLURBEHIND.dwFlags
member.summary: A bitwise combination of constant values that indicates which of the members of this structure have been set.

member.name: F:Native.DWM_BLURBEHIND.fEnable
member.summary: true to register the window handle to DWM blur behind; false to unregister the window handle from DWM blur behind.

member.name: F:Native.DWM_BLURBEHIND.hRgnBlur
member.summary: The region within the client area where the blur behind will be applied. A IntPtr.Zero value will apply the blur behind the entire client area.

member.name: F:Native.DWM_BLURBEHIND.fTransitionOnMaximized
member.summary: true if the window's colorization should transition to match the maximized windows; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Native.FLASHWINFO
member.summary: Contains the flash status for a window and the number of times the system should flash the window.

member.name: F:Native.FLASHWINFO.cbSize
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:Native.FLASHWINFO.hwnd
member.summary: A handle to the window to be flashed. The window can be either opened or minimized.

member.name: F:Native.FLASHWINFO.uCount
member.summary: The number of times to flash the window.

member.name: F:Native.FLASHWINFO.dwTimeout
member.summary: The rate at which the window is to be flashed, in milliseconds. If dwTimeout is zero, the function uses the default cursor blink rate.

member.name: T:Native.MINMAXINFO
member.summary: Contains information about a window's maximized size and position and its minimum and maximum tracking size.
member.remarks: For systems with multiple monitors, the ptMaxSize and ptMaxPosition members describe the maximized size and position of the window on the primary monitor, even if the window ultimately maximizes onto a secondary monitor. In that case, the window manager adjusts these values to compensate for differences between the primary monitor and the monitor that displays the window. Thus, if the user leaves ptMaxSize untouched, a window on a monitor larger than the primary monitor maximizes to the size of the larger monitor.

member.name: F:Native.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxSize
member.summary: The maximized width (x member) and the maximized height (y member) of the window. For top-level windows, this value is based on the width of the primary monitor.

member.name: F:Native.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxPosition
member.summary: The position of the left side of the maximized window (x member) and the position of the top of the maximized window (y member). For top-level windows, this value is based on the position of the primary monitor.

member.name: F:Native.MINMAXINFO.ptMinTrackSize
member.summary: The minimum tracking width (x member) and the minimum tracking height (y member) of the window. This value can be obtained programmatically from the system metrics SM_CXMINTRACK and SM_CYMINTRACK (see the GetSystemMetrics function).

member.name: F:Native.MINMAXINFO.ptMaxTrackSize
member.summary: The maximum tracking width (x member) and the maximum tracking height (y member) of the window. This value is based on the size of the virtual screen and can be obtained programmatically from the system metrics SM_CXMAXTRACK and SM_CYMAXTRACK (see the GetSystemMetrics function).

member.name: T:Native.MONITORINFO
member.summary: Contains information about a display monitor.

member.name: F:Native.MONITORINFO.cbSize
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:Native.MONITORINFO.rcMonitor
member.summary: A structure that specifies the display monitor rectangle, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates. Note that if the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values.

member.name: F:Native.MONITORINFO.rcWork
member.summary: A structure that specifies the work area rectangle of the display monitor, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates. Note that if the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values.

member.name: F:Native.MONITORINFO.dwFlags
member.summary: A set of flags that represent attributes of the display monitor.
